steps.message: Since we are going to have a jump server (public machine), two servers (private machines), and a load balancer (lives in public subnet). We need to create 3 sets of security lists and route tables for each of their subnet.

Select Security Lists on the left in your VCN detail page.
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/security_list_menu.png}}

We are going to create 3 security lists for Jump Server Subnet, Backend Server Subnet, and Load Balancer Subnet.
Click on Create Security List.
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/create_security_list_button.png}}

Let's create the Jump Server Subnet Security List first. Let's give it a name jump_server_security_list
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/jump_server_security_list.png}}
For a jump server, we want to allow ingress traffic to access port 22 therefore we can SSH to the machine.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/jump_server_ingress.png}}
At the same time, to make it easy, we allow all out-bounding traffic for this subnet.
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/jump_server_egress.png}}

Now we can create Backend Server Subnet Security List in similar fashion. First, we name it backend_server_security_list. Now let's give this security list a bit different rules.
Besides port 22, we now want port 80 for ingress, which allows the Load Balancer to access the servers in the future. Also, the source CIDR is limited to 10.0.0.0/16 to only allow internal traffic.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/backend_server_ingress.png}}
As for the egress rules, we still want all traffic to go out.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/jump_server_egress.png}}

At the end, let's create Load Balancer Subnet Security List with name load_balancer_security_list. It is very similar to Jump Server Subnet Security List, but we expose port 80 instead 22.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/load_balancer_ingress.png}}
As for the egress rules, we still want all traffic to go out.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/jump_server_egress.png}}
Now you should have security lists similar to the following picture. {{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/security_lists.png}}

Since we will use 2 Public Subnets and 1 Private Subnet, we would need 2 Route Table to route their traffic to either Internet Gateway or NAT Gateway. At this step, we will be creating 2 Route Tables.

Select Route Table tab from the left of VCN detail page.
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/route_table_menu.png}}
Click on the Create Route Table button.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/create_route_table_button.png}}Let's name the first Route Table public_subnet_route_table. The target type should be Internet Gateway, and all traffic (0.0.0.0/0) should be directed to the Internet Gateway we created. The configuration should be like the following picture.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/public_subnet_route_table.png}}
Similar to the above steps, now we create another route table using the name private_subnet_route_table and send all traffic (0.0.0.0/0) to NAT Gateway.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/private_subnet_route_table.png}}
Now we can move on to step 1.5
